channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Kate E. Koren Joins the CSIS Economics Program as Deputy Director
item.description: The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) announced today that Kate E. Koren has joined the CSIS Economics Program and Scholl Chair in International Business as deputy director.

item.title: Building a True Trusted Trade Partnership with the United Kingdom
item.description: Meredith Broadbent unpacks the recent agreement between the United States and United Kingdom to cooperate on pharmaceuticals and medical technology.

item.title: How Syria Can Succeed in Integrating the Kurds
item.description: Intensified conflict between the Syrian government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces could threaten Syria’s transition. Here’s what the government can do to ensure it doesn’t.

item.title: When to Use (and Not Use) “As a Service” for Government Space Requirements
item.description: Instead of buying a piece of equipment, which the government then owns and operates, the government is increasingly turning to “as-a-service” models for buying things from space. But how should the government decide between a service model or a traditional one?
